com.sterlingcommerce.baseutil

Class SCXmlUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sterlingcommerce.baseutil.SCXmlUtil

  • public class SCXmlUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for manipulating and using XML Documents, Nodes.

        public static javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder getDocumentBuilder()
                                                            throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                                   javax.xml.parsers.FactoryConfigurationError
        Utility method which creates a Document Builder
        Returns:
        The newly created Document builder
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - if a DocumentBuilder cannot be created which satisfies the configuration requested.
        javax.xml.parsers.FactoryConfigurationError - if the implementation is not available or cannot be instantiated.

        public static org.w3c.dom.Document createFromString(java.lang.String xmlStr)
        Creates an Document using the given string. If it is void, it creates an empty document.
        Parameters:
        xmlStr - The XML string from which a Document needs to be created
        Returns:
        The newly created Document
        Null in case of errors

      • write2File

        public static void write2File(org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                              java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes the XML document to the file. If the file exists, it overrides, else it creates a new one. UTF-8 is used as the file encoding. If the filename parameter is void, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        document - The document which needs to be written to a file
        fileName - The file name to which the document needs to be written
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write2File

        public static void write2File(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                              java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Writes the XML node to the file. If the file exists, it overrides, else it creates a new one. UTF-8 is used as the file encoding. If filename is void, this method has no effect.
        Parameters:
        element - The element which needs to be written to a file
        fileName - The file name to which the document needs to be written
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                                java.lang.String attributeName,
                                java.lang.String attributeValue)

        attributeName - The name of the attribute which needs to be set

      • setAttributes

        public static void setAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element fromElement,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Element toElement)
        Utility to copy all the attributes from the XML element fromElement to the XML element toElement. All extra attributes already existing in toElement are left as is. If either of the parameters is null the method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        fromElement - The element from which attributes need to copied
        toElement - The element to which attributes need to copied

      • setAttributes

        public static void setAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element fromElement,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Element toElement,
                                 boolean clearToElement)
        Utility to copy all the attributes from the XML element fromElement to the XML element toElement. Depending on the value of clearToEle, existing attributes of toElement are removed before copying to avoid having extra attributes. If either fromElement or toElement is null it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        fromElement - The element from which attributes need to copied
        toElement - The element to which attributes need to copied
        clearToElement - True to clear all the attributes of toElement before copying the attributes from the fromElement

        Parameters:
        parentElement - The parent element
        childName - The node name of child to be created
        Returns:
        The newly created child element

                                                org.w3c.dom.Element ele2beImported)

        Parameters:
        parentEle - The parent element
        ele2beImported - The element to be imported
        Returns:
        The newly created child element

      • getChildElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parentEle,
                                                  java.lang.String childName)
        Gets the child element with the given name. If not found returns null. This method returns null if either parent is null or child name is void.
        Parameters:
        parentEle - The parent element
        childName - The node name of the child to be fetched
        Returns:
        The child element

      • getChildElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parentEle,
                                                  java.lang.String childName,
                                                  boolean createIfNotExists)
        Gets the child element with the given name.
        If a child element is not found:
        • A new element will be created if "createIfNotExists" is true.
        • Null will be returned if "createIfNotExists" is false.
        Parameters:
        parentEle - The parent element
        childName - The node name of the child
        createIfNotExists - True to create a child with the given node name if not found
        Returns:
        The child element or Null if either parent is null or child name is void.

      • getFirstChildElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getFirstChildElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parentEle)
        Gets the first child element if it exists. If not found returns null. This method returns null if parent is null.
        Parameters:
        parentEle - The parent element
        Returns:
        The first child element

      • mergeElement

        public static void mergeElement(org.w3c.dom.Element fromElement,
                                org.w3c.dom.Element toElement,
                                boolean checkHasAttributeInTarget)
        Utlity to merge Elements. The new child elements of fromElement(source Element) is imported into the toElement (target Element). If the same child element already exists the attributes are merged. The new attributes of fromElement(source element) is also added into the toElement (target Element). If the attribute already exists based on checkHasAttributeInTarget the attribute is overridden to the attribute value in fromElement (source Element). If checkHasAttributeInTarget is true the attribute is not overridden otherwise it is overriden.
        Parameters:
        fromElement - is the source element
        toElement - is the target element
        checkHasAttributeInTarget - is true if the attribute need NOT be overridden.

      • mergeAttributes

        public static void mergeAttributes(org.w3c.dom.Element fromEle,
                                   org.w3c.dom.Element toEle,
                                   boolean checkHasAttributeInTarget)
        This method takes care of merging the attributes in the fromElement (source Element) to the attributes in the toElement (target Element). The new attributes of fromElement(source element) is also added into the toElement (target Element). If the attribute already exists based on checkHasAttributeInTarget the attribute is overridden to the attribute value in fromElement (source Element). If checkHasAttributeInTarget is true the attribute is not overridden otherwise it is overriden.
        Parameters:
        fromEle - is the source element
        toEle - is the target element
        checkHasAttributeInTarget - is true if the attribute need NOT be overridden.

      • getElements

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.w3c.dom.Element> getElements(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                                                   java.lang.String expression)
        Utility to get a list of Element objects by evaluating expression starting from the context of the input element.
        Parameters:
        element - The parent element
        expression - A string expression that gives the target element path from the context of the parent element
        Returns:
        List of child elements after evaluating the expression

      • getElementsByAttribute

        public static java.util.ArrayList<org.w3c.dom.Element> getElementsByAttribute(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                                                              java.lang.String expression,
                                                                              java.lang.String attrName,
                                                                              java.lang.String value)
        Utility to Get list of Element object by evaluating element expression, attribute name and attribute value starting from the context of the input element.
        Parameters:
        element - The parent element
        expression - A string expression that gives the target element path from the context of the parent element
        attrName - The name of the attribute that must be present in the target element
        value - The value of the attribute
        Returns:
        List of child elements after evaluating the expression and which contain the attribute and value

      • getElementByAttribute

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getElementByAttribute(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                                        java.lang.String expression,
                                                        java.lang.String attrName,
                                                        java.lang.String value)
        Utility to Get a Element object by evaluating element expression, attribute name and attribute value starting from the context of the input element.
        Parameters:
        element - The parent element
        expression - A string expression that gives the target element path from the context of the parent element
        attrName - The name of the attribute that must be present in the target element
        value - The value of the attribute
        Returns:

      • getChildrenList

        public static java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Element> getChildrenList(org.w3c.dom.Element parent)
        Get the list of all children of Element type.
        Note:
        Only immediate children of the element are considered
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent whose child elements are required
        Returns:
        An list of all child elements

      • getChildElementBy

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element getChildElementBy(org.w3c.dom.Element parent,
                                                    java.lang.String attributeName,
                                                    java.lang.String attributeValue)
        Gets the child element by given attribute name and corresponding there value. If not found returns null. This method returns null if either parent is null attribute no exists.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent element
        attributeName - The attribute name of the child to be fetched
        attributeValue - The attribute Value of the child to be fetched
        Returns:
        The child element

        Parameters:
        node - the node to be remove from DOM heirarchy.

        public static java.lang.String getXpathAttribute(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                                 java.lang.String xpath)
        NOTE: Using XPath can repetitively may result in poor performance. It should be used carefully and frugally.
        Parameters:
        element - The context element to evaluate xpath expression on
        xpath - A valid xpath expression pointing to an attribute node
        Returns:
        attribute value

      • mergeElement

        public static void mergeElement(org.w3c.dom.Element fromElement,
                                org.w3c.dom.Element toElement,
                                boolean checkHasAttributeInTarget,
                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> dbMap)
        Parameters:
        fromElement - is the source element
        toElement - is the target element
        checkHasAttributeInTarget - is true if the attribute need NOT be overridden.
        dbMap - Contains, Key is the repeating element node name and Value is the unique key attribute name of that node name under toElement.
